title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Near North Health Service
Interview Descriptions: ZOOM interview, very doable. Make sure you research the facility before, so you can apply the questions to the answers. Standard interview questions asked--conflict resolution, tell me about a time, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, why nursing, give me a time with conflict

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Near North Health Service
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed to come in for an interview the day after my phone screening. Interview was with DON and immediate supervisor. Interview was easy, quick and very detail. I was offered the position on the spot
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work in the medical field?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Near North Health Service
Interview Descriptions: It was very straight forward. I was asked a lot of situational questions related to my past experiences and the position I was interviewing for. I was interviewed by two individuals that works directly with the care coordinator.
Interview Questions: How do you display empathy to patients in a professional manner?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Near North Health Service
Interview Descriptions: Dr. Cox is the epitome of professionalism. She answered all questions thoroughly and was incredibly personable. The only reason I was not hired was because they had already hired multiple new graduates.
Interview Questions: Do you speak any other languages?

title: Attending Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Near North Health Service
Interview Descriptions: The interview was scheduled through the secretary via email. I had one interview with the CMO. Very laid back and casual interview. Nice mixture of questions to get to know me as well as information about the position
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself other than what is on your CV

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Near North Health Service (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a phone call a few days later. The person explained the position details and invited me in for an in-person interview. I was offered the position via email and started with the next orientation class.
Interview Questions: How would you rate your organizational skills?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Near North Health Service (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I e-mailed my resume and my cover letter to the human resources department. I got a call a couple of days later and asked to come in for an interview. I did 2 interviews, and I got a call back a week later with an offer for a clerk position. I did a drug test, I signed a document for them to do a background check, and I also did an orientation. I started my job the next day after the orientation.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths, and how will they benefit the tasks for the job?

title: Registered Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Near North Health Service (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call about 1 week after I had applied for the position and was asked to come in for an interview the next day. The process went by fast for me. A couple of hours after my interview I received a call back stating that I was hired.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Near North Health Service (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. Went through my resume and asked about my experiences. Very straight-forward. Focused more on how my past jobs prepared me for this position and how I can contribute, rather than the personality questions like "If you could be an animal, what would you be?" Very relaxed setting and was able to go through and ask about the specifics on benefits, salary, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience at...

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Near North Health Service (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very fast. Interview probably lasted less than 1 hr. I was interviewed by one of the Registered Nurses. She was friendly and made you feel comfortable during the interview.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 10 years

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Near North Health Service (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview was one on one with normal questions
